data.title: Lunch time BBQ
data.text: Was greeted by a very friendly staff and the guy even hooked us up with a free cheese jalapeño sausage. The brisket was moist and tender and the ribs were fall of the bone.

data.title: Flavorful but a little pricey
data.text:
I'm kind of a BBQ snob.  I'm very partial to pork ribs, but I appreciate good brisket.  I got two-meat special they were offering that day, which came with two sides and a drink included.  Total price was $15.64, which was on the high side for me.

There was a good smokey flavor to the ribs, but the portions seemed small to me and they weren't as tender as I like them.  I chose the hotter of the two sauces, and it had a decent kick to it.  The brisket was quite tender with nice flavor.  The beans were spiced just right, and the macaroni and cheese with smoked sausage was quite hearty.

I'd go here in a pinch, but I wasn't wowed by it.

data.title: Great barbecue But
data.text: Their barbecue is great but if they could add fresh corn or Cobb, slaw,veggies,salad. This would be a great hot spot. If you just want a bbq sandwich then this is your place and that's it. But prepare to pay.If you are a single parent on a budget look elsewhere. But if you want to splurge on some great bbq sandwiches then go. It's worth it.

data.title: Big D puts the B in BBQ
data.text: Best Bar B Q in Texas. Paired with some of the finest beers from around America and further. The owner loves his craft and it shows.

data.title: Customer service
data.text: The owner came outside and yelled and cussed at me in front of my wife and kids because we just wanted eat and they told us we would have to pay a cover charge to eat dinner. I will never go back. My youngest daughter was very upset

data.title: Best take out DELICIOUS BRISKET
data.text: We were amazed by how smoky and delicious the Sliced Brisket was. We ordered it by the pound and they included their house BBQ and a spicy BBQ to take with us. I asked for lean slices and they obliged. The paper was still full of grease...it's Brisket after all. The smoky crust, tender insides... flavorful and delicious. Will be doing this again soon.

data.title: Good bbq
data.text: The meat choices were really good. I wasn't a huge fan of the side dishes, which is why I only rated a 3. Service was very friendly.

data.title: Wonderful brisket
data.text: My husband and I were in the Mansfield area with his job. During that time we ate multiple times at Big D's. I am not one who normally likes beef brisket but I loved their beef brisket. My husband craved the beef brisket. I also enjoyed the sausages jalapeno cheese sausage and black pepper sausage. If in this area this is a must go to place

data.title: Wow! Just Wow!!!
data.text: We were traveling from OKC to Houston and found Big D on Trip Advisor so gave it a try. Hubby got rib plate and I got moist brisket plate. We had such a hard time deciding which bite would be our last!!  But after much angst we both decided to end with a rib!!  Pinto beans and slaw rocked. Green beans needed a little work.

data.title: Awesome BBQ
data.text: This was our first visit, but certainly not our last. My husband and I grew up eating great BBQ and can't seem to find that here. That was true until today..we found heaven..BBQ heaven in Mansfield. We tried brisket sandwiches with skillet taters and slaw. The brisket was soft, tons of flavor and the perfect bun. The sides were tasty!! Clean atmosphere and the food was ready immediately. Bring your friends and family..they have cobbler and banana pudding..I was just too full to experience it..there's always next time.

data.title: Real Texas BBQ
data.text: ***** We fed the whole out-of-state family some real Texas BBQ. Guys went back to take some home on the plane to LA and WA where they have no idea what real BBQ is. Big D staff is real friendly like. They'll cut you a deal if you buy a lot. You ain't had BBQ till you been to Big D. Check it out. *****

data.title: If Price is No Object
data.text: This is a very good BBQ place. The food is exceptional. But it is pretty expensive. I think Spring Creek and Rudy's are better values, with better side options, but the meats here are top notch.

data.title: Best BBQ Ribs
data.text: Love love their bbq ribs! It's definitely the best bbq place in town. Their bbq chicken is great too. Not a fan of their sides but worth going for the meats. It's a pretty good size place.

data.title: Lunch with the fam
data.text:
Best "Burnt Ends Brisket" I've ever had!!

Also tried the jalepeno sausage and my wife's chicken...all good choices!  Be sure to get the skillet taters too.

data.title: Nice people, very good BBQ
data.text: If you are use to walking by the pits and selecting your hand crafted BBQ, as is the tradition at most of Texas' best, Big D might fool you.  It has none of that.  It is in a small strip center that doesn't denote the kind of quality a true BBQ aficionado is normally looking for, but don't be dismayed.  Inside are folks who care about what they do and some of the best BBQ you'll find anywhere. If you are the kind of person who has traveled out of their way on numerous occasions to try out BBQ in places like Lockhart and Llano, then you will appreciate what makes Big D worth your time.

data.title: Great bar b Que, high prices
data.text: The bar b Que was great but the amount given for the price paid was not good. I'd rather go somewhere that I get more for my money.

data.title: Best damn BBQ in the metroplex
data.text:
The atmosphere for lunch and early dinner is that of a small shop.  Very quaint and small town.  Every employee is welcoming and genuinely happy you are here.  All are helpful.  The food is great.  Get there early cause the can run out of your favorite meat.
The brisket and ribs are my choice here.  With the smoked turkey rounding out my top 3.

There are two sauces a regular and a spicy.  I prefer the mix them for a good combo of spice and flavor.

Friday and Saturday nights the place opens up a bit and has live music.

data.title: First Big D BBQ Visit
data.text:
We were looking for a new place for lunch and found Big D BBQ in Masfield on the Internet search.  I had the brisket and turkey, wife had the BBQ chicken.  Sides included skillet potatoes, green beans and Cole slaw.  Everything was fantastic.   Loved the bark own the brisket, turkey was not over smoked, and the chicken was the best we have ever had in a restaurant.  The skillet potatoes were superb, wish I had the recipe.  The green beans were done just right and the Cole slaw met my wife's approval.

Big D BBQ is definitely on our list of places to return to.  Try it, you will like it.

data.title: Awesome #BBQ
data.text:
What an awesome place to get bbq, we had chopped beef and taters. It was great bbq and very nice staff!! We will be back!!!
Micheal

data.title: Wow very good
data.text: Very nice place, the ribs are quite hot and spicy, so just know that. Brisket is amazing it ain't cheap so bring you money. But it is authentic BBQ.
